amendment.description: Amendment expresses the sense of Congress that the United States should not prohibit the importation of Cuban cigars into the United States. \ As amended by the Diaz-Balart amendment (A036), language was added conditioning the above on the government of Cuba freeing all political prisoners, legalizing all political activity, and agreeing to hold free and fair elections.
amendment.purpose: An amendment expressing the sense of Congress that the U.S. government should not prohibit the importation, sale, or distribution of Cuban cigars in the United States.

action.text: On agreeing to the Miller (CA) amendment (A035) as amended Agreed to by recorded vote: 375 - 49 (Roll No. 175).
Mr. Serrano demanded a separate vote on the Miller (CA) amendment (A035) as amended.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Miller (CA) amendment (A035) as amended Agreed to by recorded vote: 366 - 59 (Roll no. 197).
